Speed-up from parallel computation

Source: vignettes/parallel-computation.Rmd
parallel-computation.Rmd
library(ggplot2)
theme_set(theme_minimal())
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(simcity)
#> Loading required package: doParallel
#> Loading required package: foreach
#> Loading required package: iterators
#> Loading required package: parallel
#> Loading required package: doRNG
#> Loading required package: rngtools
#> Loading required package: glmnet
#> Loading required package: Matrix
#> Loaded glmnet 4.1-4
#> Loading required package: hdi
#> Loading required package: scalreg
#> Loading required package: lars
#> Loaded lars 1.3
set.seed(1)
n <- 100
p <- 200
s0 <- 10
niters <- 100
system.time(
  many_lassos_unparallel <- 
    replicate(niters, instance_hdr(n, p, s0))
)
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>  15.500   4.526  16.507
if (require(pbapply)) {
  system.time(
  many_lassos_pbunparallel <- 
    pbreplicate(niters, instance_hdr(n, p, s0))
  )
}
#> Loading required package: pbapply
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>  15.389   4.485  16.343
system.time(
  many_lassos_2cores <- 
    simulate_hdr(niters, n, p, s0, cores = 2)
)
#> 
  |                                                                            
  |                                                                      |   0%
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.056   0.010  11.948
system.time(
  many_lassos_2cores <- 
    simulate_hdr(niters, n, p, s0, cores = 4)
)
#> 
  |                                                                            
  |                                                                      |   0%
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.061   0.011   9.720
